headline: Stage-Specific Expression Pattern with Extreme Sporozoite and Late Schizont Upregulation
one_paragraph_summary:
This gene exhibits one of the most dramatic stage-specific expression patterns in Plasmodium falciparum, with exceptionally high expression in sporozoites (>3000 TPM, 99th percentile) and late schizont stages (>1500 TPM, 96-99th percentile), while maintaining minimal expression during trophozoite stages (<50 TPM). The gene shows
  • Over 300-fold upregulation from trophozoites to schizonts during asexual development
  • Dramatically higher expression in mosquito-derived versus cultured sporozoites
  • Consistent biphasic expression patterns during intraerythrocytic development cycles
. The extreme sporozoite-specific expression and late schizont upregulation suggest this gene plays critical roles in parasite transmission, host cell invasion, or late-stage replication processes, potentially functioning in sporozoite infectivity or merozoite formation.

topics.headline: Dramatic Stage-Specific Upregulation During Intraerythrocytic Development
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene shows consistent >300-fold upregulation from trophozoite to late schizont stages across multiple intraerythrocytic development studies, with peak expression reaching 1500-6000 TPM during schizont stages.

topics.headline: Exceptional Sporozoite-Specific Expression with Mosquito Vector Dependency
topics.one_sentence_summary: Expression reaches extremely high levels in sporozoites (>3000 TPM, 99th percentile) with dramatically higher expression in mosquito-derived compared to cultured sporozoites, indicating critical roles in natural transmission.

topics.headline: Biphasic Expression Patterns During Asexual Blood Stage Cycles
topics.one_sentence_summary: The gene displays consistent biphasic expression with peaks during early ring and late schizont stages across multiple time-series studies, showing >20-fold dynamic expression ranges.
